Post_body: [via @tuttosport] üö® Inter is 'very' interested in Nico Paz. Tactically, the club believes the 20-year-old could be shaped into Inzaghi's 'new Luis Alberto'. A mezzala with a knack for goals and assists, continuing the legacy of Henrikh Mkhitaryan. üá¶üá∑

Commenti.Body:
ü§ñ *This post contains transfer market news. Make sure to check out our wiki article Transfer News Reliability Tier List [HERE](https://www.reddit.com/r/FCInterMilan/wiki/transfer-news-reliability-guide).*

---

^(I am a bot. If you would like to know more about me, you can visit our wiki article Inter Bot Commands) ^[HERE](https://www.reddit.com/r/FCInterMilan/wiki/bot-commands). ^(If you think there was a mistake, please contact us using Mod Mail. Thank you!)

Yes ts is a üí©source full of rube ü§° but this is also come from Daniele Mari:

üö® Inter‚Äôs market strategy is set to change drastically. Less signings older than 30- no more Dzeko‚Äôs, or Mkhitaryan‚Äôs, or Acerbi‚Äôs. More young profiles like Nico Paz or Santi Castro. Players who may cost a bit, but may be worth double in the future. ‚ö´Ô∏èüîµ

- Inzy answered a question about Paz in the press con. That itself is confirmation that we're serious. He said he's been told his *personality & character* is quite good. That means the *technical* consideration & evaluation has already been approved.

- His big quality is dribbling, which Inzy has (in the past) said our squad currently lacks. 

- His father is quite friendly with JZ4 (a subtle shot/ confirmation vis-a-vis Samar).

- A report said Real are unlikely to buy him back cause they're already filled in that dept. Another said they've *already* exercised it to take him back next summer. Yet another said we'll use a Brahim-Milan style deal (long term option to buy back etc.).

- Marotta said (and I paraphrase) "we'll not make any deals in Jan. unless it's for a young talent we like, and the economic conditions are on our terms.  

All-in-all, we seem really serious, but it's probably for the summer.
Really want him now, but don't mind waiting until the summer. I fear his value will only keep going up the more he plays, though.

What if they‚Äôre playing mind games? They may be not interested in Nico Paz but want to gather attention of other clubs around him in order to generate a sort of competition among the top 5 that will distract Directors of other clubs, while our focus is on someone else
Madrid have a long history of triggering buyback clauses on their former academy players and selling them right away for profit
Probably no point getting him now since it would be a bit more expensive signing mid season and Piotr is already getting no minutes as is so adding another player in that posiion wouldn't be useful.
Did we do this in the past?
Beppe Marotta might look like him, but he‚Äôs not Varys in real life also I‚Äôm sure he‚Äôs a eunuch
